title: Great Speaker Handicapped by CRAP APP
text:
These wonderful sounding speakers are severely handicapped by the crappy quality app. I have two Devialet Silver Phantoms and one dialogue. They are all directly Ethernet wired to the same Ethernet switch...they should have no trouble finding each other. I have set this system up now every day for the last week...which takes 10 minutes each time...because it loses the speakers every time you stop using the app. Every time. So the next time you fire up the app you need to reconfigure your whole system all over again...factory restarts of all three components and having the dialogue find the speakers again.  
If I could return them I would, but I bought them a few months back while building a house and now I am past the return window. I also have Sonos speakers and while they are inferior in sonic quality, the Sonos app works every time. Every time ... 
Devialet should stop putting R&D into more powerful speakers and just get the app right first.

title: Piece of crap
text:
The Phantom / Dialog combo has been around for a few years now, but till now, Devialet can’t get their act together. I bought 2 Gold, 2 Silver and 2 Dialog. Every time I switched them off, I need to reconfigure the whole setup again. One Dialog died, while the other one keeps losing its configuration. Even as a single Bluetooth speaker, it keeps disconnecting every few minutes.

My Sonos back from 2004 plays every time with no hiccups. Same for the Apple HomePod, unlike this Devialet junk.

The Phantom manages to play, the music is clear cut above both Sonos and the HomePod. But it’s a hair pulling experience just getting them to work. In the end, I prefer to use the Sonos and the HomePod, with the Phantoms as decorative objects.

Devialet should stop bragging about having the best wireless speaker in the world and all their marketing mumbo jumbo. They can’t even get the basics right. Their software is a disaster and they seem to be pouring money in marketing instead of getting their system to work. 

Shame on you Devialet for overcharging your customers, selling them a non functional system and leaving your customers hanging with no recourse!

title: Defeated.
text:
This is the worst app I’ve ever used. It simply *Refuses* to locate my phantom. I have done everything to get this thing to find it. It just won’t do it. 
The usual issue is - “open wifi and look for ‘phantom xxxxx’ WiFi network” but it’s never there. 
The number of times this app has told me to factory reset or to pull the plug for 10 seconds is unacceptable. 
About 1 in 50 times the app will actually go from 0-connected without any prompts, but when it does the connection is so weak that within 15 seconds it’s completely gone and you have to start over. 
I’m happy that my phantoms power was bumped up to 103dB, but it’s a hard slap in the face because I can’t use the product I paid $2000 for.

Devialet fix your product.

title: Great Speaker - horrible product
text:
What truly awesome speaker! Unfortunately the frustration of actually using the speakers kills the great sound experience.
Why can't it support standards like Bluetooth or AirPlay?
Why can't I stream market leading music play apps like Spotify or Apple Music? 
Why can't I configure the Dialog through wifi only? 
The decision to play only through your own app means you have to produce a market leading music playing app, and this simply isn't. 
It's just too cumbersome to import a playlist into the app only to discover that some songs can't be played. It's simply a horribly ineffective interface. 
The speaker market is hugely competitive and this product can only be successful once these flaws are addressed. Wait with buying the Phantom Speakers.

title: Devialet w/ 2 golds & dialogue
text:
I have two golds set in stereo, connected with the devialet dialog over WiFi. I also have the wireless remote (which is kind of useless but very nice at small volume tweaks)

The system is extremely stable (there are hiccups every now and then - but only once every 6-8 months or so)... the sound is unparalleled and remarkable - the best you can buy for a $7k setup. (I compared this to Bose, Bang and Olufson, and Sonos - Devialet wins every time)

Mine runs everything through the tv via an Apple TV (which the new one connects instantly when it starts so you don’t have to bother with reconnecting like the old one - but every time the Apple TV is hard restarted you simply need to go to settings and re establish the connection with the dialog)

The combination of dialog to golds via WiFi for Music via Spotify and Apple TV for movies has created a highly reliable setup second to none!
